The intrapreneur has worked part-time for 4-6 months on the project.

0b60e220-66c8-487c-94ad-fa44e159604d.description: Courageous decision making is a key priority for Ericsson and represents striking a careful balance between accuracy and innovation. There are a range of opportunities to drive a more proactive and courageous decision-making culture to reflect the aims of this focus area. By establishing a more robust risk appetite across the organization, Ericsson has become a business where courageous decisions are made every day.
0b60e220-66c8-487c-94ad-fa44e159604d.name: MANA Networks Engineering Excellence - Courageous

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Found balance between accuracy in taking action and innovative thinking. 2) Brought the true SMEs together to present, review and discuss the facts, data, and risks for the decision-making process. 3) Narrowed the number of decision makers at each stage of the process to avoid taking action only after reaching full consensus. 4) Took accountability for the decision no matter the result and learned from decisions that are not successful. 5) Showed willingness to make difficult decisions.

1ca5801e-dea6-4efb-bf9c-e7aa11ee8907.description: Ericsson develops a collective vision of acting speedily across the organization, as it is an advanced skill to be able to determine when speed should be prioritized over quality. Creating more clarity around roles in the execution process and combining this with a collective vision for success helps develop a culture that strikes a balance between speed and quality, while empowering people to move at speed, without the risk of changes from above.
1ca5801e-dea6-4efb-bf9c-e7aa11ee8907.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Speedy (Q4_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Determined which situations (taking the customer need, costs and resources into consideration) where executing with speed was more important than executing with quality and diligence 2). Clearly defined roles and responsibilities within the project execution process as early and as often as possible 3). Established a collective purpose/vision for each project and made sure everyone was aligned 4). Empowered teams and colleagues to work with greater speed and urgency when necessary

7adff7e8-3f10-4fa6-b1ff-1ad14dd8e999.description: At Ericsson ONE, our mission is to create new growth businesses by giving our intrapreneurs and innovators the chance to shape the future. This badge is awarded to employees at Ericsson with business ideas that has the potential in becoming a game-changer for Ericsson. The intrapreneurs has proven to be: Curious – driven by the need to grow, learn and disrupt the status quo. Brave – would rather try and fail than not try at all. This is 1 out of 3 levels of badges.
7adff7e8-3f10-4fa6-b1ff-1ad14dd8e999.name: Intrapreneur - Ericsson One

badge_template_activities.title: To receive the badges the intrapreneur must:
Have successfully completed the Innovation process: The intrapreneur has identified a need in the market and strong pain point. Verified a customer need.
Learning Completions: Participated in the initiation and ideation modules of the Learning  program.
Passed the pitching milestones:  Presented to a local board of  10+ advisors and experts
The intrapreneur has worked on the idea during his/her own time

1ae77720-059f-4def-8693-ceaa4671fe69.description: Ericsson strives to enhance the collaborative spirit within the organization. Emphasis is on a ‘One Ericsson’ approach; working towards shared goals and striving for collective success. Clarity on how people should collaborate, and who they should collaborate with at the right time, will create a culture where teams operate with a common goal and purposefully collaborate.
1ae77720-059f-4def-8693-ceaa4671fe69.name: MANA Networks Engineering Excellence - Collaboration

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Took a true “One Ericsson” approach by sharing goals, best practices and information with colleagues. 2) Provided clear guidance on who should collaborate on projects and how to do it efficiently and inclusively. 3) Created a culture where teams operate with common goals and work purposefully to support each other, our company and our customers.

2cce3828-2845-4d36-81d8-7c5d59d7dd0b.description: Ericsson is passionate about the important role feedback plays in the development of people at all levels. A key area of opportunity to drive cultural change is ensuring that people feel comfortable to challenge the status quo or provide constructive feedback without concern of redress.
2cce3828-2845-4d36-81d8-7c5d59d7dd0b.name: MANA Networks Engineering Excellence - Speak Up

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Asked for and welcomed feedback to work, presentations and/or ideas. 2) Provided constructive feedback in a respectful way. 3) Backing up that feedback with facts and experience rather than opinion and bias. 4) Utilized the active listening approach to accept feedback from colleagues and asked follow-up questions. 5) Never retaliated or “re-loaded” with a response out of frustration about the feedback itself or the colleague providing the feedback.

f163d45b-0fa4-4ebc-875b-6f989c699350.description: Runner-up in Innovation Challenge 2019 finals, arranged by Service Area Network Design & Optimization (NDO). a0f81dfb-3a16-4051-afd7-c2118b918bcb.description: Ericsson develops a collective vision of acting speedily across the organization, as it is an advanced skill to be able to determine when speed should be prioritized over quality. Creating more clarity around roles in the execution process and combining this with a collective vision for success helps develop a culture that strikes a balance between speed and quality, while empowering people to move at speed, without the risk of changes from above.
a0f81dfb-3a16-4051-afd7-c2118b918bcb.name: MANA Networks Engineering Excellence - Speedy

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Determined which situations (taking the customer need, costs and resources into consideration) where executing with speed was more important than executing with quality and diligence. 2) Clearly defined roles and responsibilities within the project execution process as early and as often as possible. 3) Established a collective purpose/vision for each project and made sure everyone was aligned. 4) Empowered teams and colleagues to work with greater speed and urgency when necessary.

145abebf-4758-49d6-928d-619c43b71f9d.description: Ericsson strives to enhance the collaborative spirit within the organization. Emphasis is on a ‘One Ericsson’ approach; working towards shared goals and striving for collective success. Clarity on how people should collaborate, and who they should collaborate with at the right time, will create a culture where teams operate with a common goal and purposefully collaborate.
145abebf-4758-49d6-928d-619c43b71f9d.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Collaboration (Q4_2021)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Took a true “One Ericsson” approach by sharing goals, best practices and information with colleagues. 2). Provided clear guidance on who should collaborate on projects and how to do it efficiently and inclusively. 3). Created a culture where teams operate with common goals and work purposefully to support each other, our company and our customers.

f4f2edc3-6db5-4f12-be03-832d9a927990.description: Ericsson believe that empathy and humanness are crucial qualities that contribute to an environment of belongingness, openness and respect. There are opportunities to shift from a passive to active focus on empathy and humanness, deepening the understanding of colleagues’ motivations and needs.
f4f2edc3-6db5-4f12-be03-832d9a927990.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Humanness (Q2_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Created an environment of belonging, openness and respect. 2). Proactively sought out opportunities to understand teams and colleagues’ motivations and needs 3). Ensured that interactions with team members were not solely transactional 4). Used small talk in meetings and 1:1 settings to get to know the team on a more personal level 5). Made decisions about work (project requests, overtime, new assignments) with fairness and understanding

426930b2-f8f8-4809-8c8c-636fbfbc575b.description: Ericsson is passionate about the important role feedback plays in the development of people at all levels. A key area of opportunity to drive cultural change is ensuring that people feel comfortable to challenge the status quo or provide constructive feedback without concern of redress.
426930b2-f8f8-4809-8c8c-636fbfbc575b.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Speak Up (Q4_2021)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Asked for and welcomed feedback to work, presentations and/or ideas 2). Provided constructive feedback in a respectful way 3). Backing up that feedback with facts and experience rather than opinion and bias 4). Utilized the active listening approach to accept feedback from colleagues and asked follow-up questions 5). Never retaliated or “re-loaded” with a response out of frustration about the feedback itself or the colleague providing the feedback.

21f1fc21-29b8-4734-91a3-d9249e41a8ef.description: Ericsson develops a collective vision of acting speedily across the organization, as it is an advanced skill to be able to determine when speed should be prioritized over quality. Creating more clarity around roles in the execution process and combining this with a collective vision for success helps develop a culture that strikes a balance between speed and quality, while empowering people to move at speed, without the risk of changes from above.
21f1fc21-29b8-4734-91a3-d9249e41a8ef.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Speedy (Q2_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Determined which situations (taking the customer need, costs and resources into consideration) where executing with speed was more important than executing with quality and diligence 2). Clearly defined roles and responsibilities within the project execution process as early and as often as possible 3). Established a collective purpose/vision for each project and made sure everyone was aligned 4). Empowered teams and colleagues to work with greater speed and urgency when necessary

This is 2nd out of 3 levels of badges.

badge_template_activities.title: To receive the badges the intrapreneur must:

Built the project: Built a prototype.
Learning Completions: Participated in the initiation and ideation modules of the Learning program.
Passed the pitching milestones: Presented to a global board of 30+ advisors and experts
The intrapreneur has worked part-time for 4-6 months on the project.

10057d2b-3eca-4bb1-8809-1f5af76917fd.description: Courageous decision making is a key priority for Ericsson and represents striking a careful balance between accuracy and innovation. There are a range of opportunities to drive a more proactive and courageous decision-making culture to reflect the aims of this focus area. By establishing a more robust risk appetite across the organization, Ericsson has become a business where courageous decisions are made every day.
10057d2b-3eca-4bb1-8809-1f5af76917fd.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Courageous (Q4_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Found balance between accuracy in taking action and innovative thinking 2). Brought the true SMEs together to present, review and discuss the facts, data, and risks for the decision-making process 3). Narrowed the number of decision makers at each stage of the process to avoid taking action only after reaching full consensus 4). Took accountability for the decision no matter the result and learned from decisions that are not successful 5). Showed willingness to make difficult decisions

c956a360-879b-4017-b80f-0acf538416ef.description: Ericsson strives to enhance the collaborative spirit within the organization. Emphasis is on a ‘One Ericsson’ approach; working towards shared goals and striving for collective success. Clarity on how people should collaborate, and who they should collaborate with at the right time, will create a culture where teams operate with a common goal and purposefully collaborate.
c956a360-879b-4017-b80f-0acf538416ef.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Collaboration (Q1_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Took a true “One Ericsson” approach by sharing goals, best practices and information with colleagues. 2). Provided clear guidance on who should collaborate on projects and how to do it efficiently and inclusively. 3). Created a culture where teams operate with common goals and work purposefully to support each other, our company and our customers.

d0ec7fc8-ed44-43f7-b589-ebcee5fd0dc1.description: Courageous decision making is a key priority for Ericsson and represents striking a careful balance between accuracy and innovation. There are a range of opportunities to drive a more proactive and courageous decision-making culture to reflect the aims of this focus area. By establishing a more robust risk appetite across the organization, Ericsson has become a business where courageous decisions are made every day.
d0ec7fc8-ed44-43f7-b589-ebcee5fd0dc1.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Courageous (Q2_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Found balance between accuracy in taking action and innovative thinking 2). Brought the true SMEs together to present, review and discuss the facts, data, and risks for the decision-making process 3). Narrowed the number of decision makers at each stage of the process to avoid taking action only after reaching full consensus 4). Took accountability for the decision no matter the result and learned from decisions that are not successful 5). Showed willingness to make difficult decisions

1382b65f-1ef6-4520-8ed3-774abe26a6c7.description: Ericsson believe that empathy and humanness are crucial qualities that contribute to an environment of belongingness, openness and respect. There are opportunities to shift from a passive to active focus on empathy and humanness, deepening the understanding of colleagues’ motivations and needs.
1382b65f-1ef6-4520-8ed3-774abe26a6c7.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Humanness (Q3_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Created an environment of belonging, openness and respect. 2). Proactively sought out opportunities to understand teams and colleagues’ motivations and needs 3). Ensured that interactions with team members were not solely transactional 4). Used small talk in meetings and 1:1 settings to get to know the team on a more personal level 5). Made decisions about work (project requests, overtime, new assignments) with fairness and understanding

784e0ab1-7b3a-4139-99da-899cbdda79c2.description: Ericsson is passionate about the important role feedback plays in the development of people at all levels. A key area of opportunity to drive cultural change is ensuring that people feel comfortable to challenge the status quo or provide constructive feedback without concern of redress.
784e0ab1-7b3a-4139-99da-899cbdda79c2.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Speak Up (Q2_2022)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Asked for and welcomed feedback to work, presentations and/or ideas 2). Provided constructive feedback in a respectful way 3). Backing up that feedback with facts and experience rather than opinion and bias 4). Utilized the active listening approach to accept feedback from colleagues and asked follow-up questions 5). Never retaliated or “re-loaded” with a response out of frustration about the feedback itself or the colleague providing the feedback.

badge_template_activities.title: To receive the badges the intrapreneur must:

Built the project:  Successfull MVP trails with clear proof points.
Built a strong core team
Passed the pitching milestones: Operational readiness check
Passed the pitching milestones: Presented to Head of BTEB, Group CFO and CMO
Successfully participated in Learning Program: the Incubation module
The intrapreneur has worked full-time for 6-8 months on the project

04d28c1b-67bf-4856-9d17-c4b7f921ffb8.description: Ericsson is passionate about the important role feedback plays in the development of people at all levels. A key area of opportunity to drive cultural change is ensuring that people feel comfortable to challenge the status quo or provide constructive feedback without concern of redress.
04d28c1b-67bf-4856-9d17-c4b7f921ffb8.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Speak Up (Q3_2021)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Asked for and welcomed feedback to work, presentations and/or ideas 2). Provided constructive feedback in a respectful way 3). Backing up that feedback with facts and experience rather than opinion and bias 4). Utilized the active listening approach to accept feedback from colleagues and asked follow-up questions 5). Never retaliated or “re-loaded” with a response out of frustration about the feedback itself or the colleague providing the feedback.

f30eb42a-75eb-45cd-b341-c7e8df384551.description: This badge is awarded to candidates who have successfully demonstrated Sales Consulting knowledge necessary to identify and communicate the value of Ericsson portfolio and position Ericsson as a thought leader and trusted partner.
f30eb42a-75eb-45cd-b341-c7e8df384551.name: SET2WIN Sales Foundation Sales Consulting badge 2021

badge_template_activities.title: The candidate has successfully demonstrated Sales Consulting knowledge. 80f48062-37fe-4fa7-a686-7e20a7dc5980.description: This badge is awarded to candidates who have successfully demonstrated knowledge of managing Sales Negotiations necessary to drive opportunities and create profitable, longer lasting and highly sustainable customer relationships.
80f48062-37fe-4fa7-a686-7e20a7dc5980.name: SET2WIN Sales Foundation Sales Negotiation badge 2022

badge_template_activities.title: The candidate has successfully demonstrated knowledge of Sales Negotiations. Program requirements include: completing the 2-day Situational Sales Negotiation instructor-led course, completing the mandatory pre-work for the SSN instructor-led course, attending the virtual coaching reinforcement for SSN and completing the “Beyond Negotiations Skills for Capturing More Value Across the Entire Customer Lifecycle” e-learning. Participating as a coachee in a Peer Coaching Lab is an optional activity.

c96f74a2-804f-4676-9238-2a217810ed72.description: A Community Leader initiates and builds opportunities for growth through communities of practice. By sharing their expertise, Community Leaders enable learning cross-functionally and continuously over time at Ericsson. Hence, they are great Ericsson-ambassadors inside, and sometimes outside the organization. This badge is a way for Ericsson to honor our Community Leaders and to foster life-long learning.
c96f74a2-804f-4676-9238-2a217810ed72.name: Teach for Ericsson - Community Leader 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of three knowledge sharing sessions within 24 months, with an evaluation higher than the defined threshold level.

cbe63473-08ff-4465-947d-5c4c2157222e.description: Experts need to share their expertise to continuously grow individually and professionally. The Teach for Ericsson badge is a recognition of individuals who demonstrate the go-ahead spirit to teach others, and share their expertise and knowledge with colleagues. The badge is a way for Ericsson to recognize our teaching experts, and to foster a culture where learning and sharing happens everyday. The earner of this badge is both an expert in his or her domain and a role model.
cbe63473-08ff-4465-947d-5c4c2157222e.name: Teach for Ericsson - Industry Expert 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of three knowledge sharing sessions within 24 months, with an evaluation higher than the defined threshold level.

c8632fcf-07d3-4940-9341-7cbb46d546cc.description: Industry Experts are experienced subject matter experts who inspire and help others to grow. Industry Experts do not only share their expertise internally at Ericsson, but are also renowned outside of the organization. With their substantial experience, they are the leading experts in their area and contribute to our Teachers Community. This badge is a way for Ericsson to honor our experts and to foster life-long learning.
c8632fcf-07d3-4940-9341-7cbb46d546cc.name: Teach for Ericsson - Industry Expert 2022

345026e2-4705-4833-a111-0ba0e8b33402.description: 5G Pioneers Programme raises digital skills, knowledge, and awareness of emerging technologies in the Telecom and IT sectors. e0208dbf-1941-4973-8fac-7f8ef48b7567.description: In partnership with Combient Mix and Ericsson Global Technology and Learning and Development, Mentors volunteered 50+ hours over the 11-week program to share their expertise and experiences in applying data science and machine learning to advance the AI/ML capabilities with participants in the program and specifically in their project teams. In the process, mentors strengthened their mentoring and teaching skills, collaboration and professional networking, and technical capabilities.

badge_template_activities.title: For each of the weeks in the self-paced part of the program, reviewed course materials and weekly assignments and be prepared to discuss them with your project team. For the project phase of the program, become familiar with the use case assigned to the project team as well as the supporting data and guided participants to apply the data science process to the use case to develop a solution. Four to six hours per week were spent supporting project teams for the 11-week program.

aa765b2d-586f-4608-b86d-383fc0b56db1.description: Ericsson strives to enhance the collaborative spirit within the organization. Emphasis is on a ‘One Ericsson’ approach; working towards shared goals and striving for collective success. Clarity on how people should collaborate, and who they should collaborate with at the right time, will create a culture where teams operate with a common goal and purposefully collaborate.
aa765b2d-586f-4608-b86d-383fc0b56db1.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Collaboration (Q1_2021)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Took a true “One Ericsson” approach by sharing goals, best practices and information with colleagues. 2). Provided clear guidance on who should collaborate on projects and how to do it efficiently and inclusively. 3). Created a culture where teams operate with common goals and work purposefully to support each other, our company and our customers.

dd67b8d6-e6f3-4376-8844-59fce5d7c138.description: Ericsson strives to enhance the collaborative spirit within the organization. 3dd7114b-0da1-465a-aeec-0000f433476e.description: Courageous decision making is a key priority for Ericsson and represents striking a careful balance between accuracy and innovation. There are a range of opportunities to drive a more proactive and courageous decision-making culture to reflect the aims of this focus area. By establishing a more robust risk appetite across the organization, Ericsson has become a business where courageous decisions are made every day.
3dd7114b-0da1-465a-aeec-0000f433476e.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Courageous (Q1_2021)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Found balance between accuracy in taking action and innovative thinking 2). Brought the true SMEs together to present, review and discuss the facts, data, and risks for the decision-making process 3). Narrowed the number of decision makers at each stage of the process to avoid taking action only after reaching full consensus 4). Took accountability for the decision no matter the result and learned from decisions that are not successful 5). Showed willingness to make difficult decisions

edfd79b5-f21e-43f0-a11b-89669a3b7e16.description: Courageous decision making is a key priority for Ericsson and represents striking a careful balance between accuracy and innovation. There are a range of opportunities to drive a more proactive and courageous decision-making culture to reflect the aims of this focus area. By establishing a more robust risk appetite across the organization, Ericsson has become a business where courageous decisions are made every day.
edfd79b5-f21e-43f0-a11b-89669a3b7e16.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Courageous (Q2_2021)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Found balance between accuracy in taking action and innovative thinking 2). Brought the true SMEs together to present, review and discuss the facts, data, and risks for the decision-making process 3). Narrowed the number of decision makers at each stage of the process to avoid taking action only after reaching full consensus 4). Took accountability for the decision no matter the result and learned from decisions that are not successful 5). Showed willingness to make difficult decisions

0ae00597-4380-4a6b-a937-06a0ba90342b.description: Ericsson believe that empathy and humanness are crucial qualities that contribute to an environment of belongingness, openness and respect. There are opportunities to shift from a passive to active focus on empathy and humanness, deepening the understanding of colleagues’ motivations and needs.
0ae00597-4380-4a6b-a937-06a0ba90342b.name: Engineering Excellence Awards – Humanness (Q1_2021)

badge_template_activities.title: 1). Created an environment of belonging, openness and respect. 2). Proactively sought out opportunities to understand teams and colleagues’ motivations and needs 3). Ensured that interactions with team members were not solely transactional 4). Used small talk in meetings and 1:1 settings to get to know the team on a more personal level 5). Made decisions about work (project requests, overtime, new assignments) with fairness and understanding

99f3ecc2-f632-43c4-8bbf-4369fe6d6261.description: Ericsson develops a collective vision of acting speedily across the organization, as it is an advanced skill to be able to determine when speed should be prioritized over quality. 54a52b50-c713-4bdc-be77-0a9bbcd41fb5.description: At Ericsson ONE, our mission is to create new growth businesses by giving our intrapreneurs and innovators the chance to shape the future. This badge is awarded to employees at Ericsson with business ideas that has the potential in becoming a game-changer for Ericsson. The intrapreneurs has proven to be: Curious – driven by the need to grow, learn and disrupt the status quo. Brave – would rather try and fail than not try at all. This is 2nd out of 3 levels of badges.
54a52b50-c713-4bdc-be77-0a9bbcd41fb5.name: Intrapreneur- Ericsson ONE

badge_template_activities.title: To receive the badges the intrapreneur must:
Have successfully completed the Innovation process: The intrapreneur has identified a need in the market and strong pain point. Verified a customer need.
Built the project:  Built a prototype.
Learning Completions: Participated in the initiation and ideation modules of the Learning  program.
Passed the pitching milestones:  Presented to a global board of 30+ advisors and experts
The intrapreneur has worked part-time for 4-6 months on the project.

dcf282d3-c349-4627-bc53-70ead13d029b.description: The Leaders Core Curriculum (LCC) is Ericsson’s foundation-level leadership development program that focuses on developing the core leadership capabilities needed to drive performance. Over the course of this 15-week program, leaders develop their self-awareness, learn how to flex their leadership style, understand what drives and motivates a team, and how to influence and collaborate effectively across a matrix organization.
dcf282d3-c349-4627-bc53-70ead13d029b.name: Leaders Core Curriculum Program 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate to 5 virtual workshops (20 hours in total); complete self-directed eLearning (8 learning pathways in Degreed), participate to peer-to-peer coaching sessions, and ongoing learning application and experimentation with new ways of working (approx. 25 hours in total).

68c7564d-4254-489d-a939-ae8771e17c00.description: The Leaders Core Curriculum (LCC) is Ericsson’s foundation-level leadership development program that focuses on developing the core leadership capabilities needed to drive performance. Over the course of this 15-week program, leaders develop their self-awareness, learn how to flex their leadership style, understand what drives and motivates a team, and how to influence and collaborate effectively across a matrix organization.
68c7564d-4254-489d-a939-ae8771e17c00.name: Leaders Core Curriculum Program 2022-2023

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate to 5 virtual workshops (22 hours in total); complete self-directed eLearning (8 learning pathways in Degreed), participate to peer-to-peer coaching sessions, and ongoing learning application and experimentation with new ways of working (approx. 25 hours in total).

74eba6e8-5050-46c5-b10a-54268c61952c.description: This badge is awarded to candidates who have successfully demonstrated the digital business transformation knowledge and competence required to complete the Leading Digital Transformation Workshop as specified in program criteria.
74eba6e8-5050-46c5-b10a-54268c61952c.name: Leading Digital Transformation Workshop Badge 2019

badge_template_activities.title: The candidate has successfully applied knowledge related to digital business transformation skills, leading in a digital world, customer centricity, emerging technologies, automation, AI, data-driven business, agile ways of working, and culture needed for business transformation. Program requirements include: active participation in 5 modules, successful completion of assignments, and a final project of a Digital Activation Plan to execute on the learnings. Program duration is 20 h over 6 weeks.

49b4ba66-346a-4def-bd7c-ad16b95f056a.description: Leading for Imp​act​ is designed specifically for experienced people leaders who are responsible for driving organizational change in a complex and ever-changing business environment. Over the course of this 15-week program, senior leaders at Ericsson deep-dive on the concept of leadership agility, experiment with new ways of working, and apply key learnings to real business challenges.
49b4ba66-346a-4def-bd7c-ad16b95f056a.name: Leading for Impact Program 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all required elements of the program

skills.name: Leading Others Motivating And Engaging Others

5d0cda38-f302-498c-99fe-cc96df30cd4b.description: An Ericsson Advanced Lean-Agile Scrum Master badge reflects advanced training, certification and an extended experience base of using Scaled Agile Framework® principles to execute the Scrum Master role in the context of the entire enterprise, including successfully planning and executing the Program Increment (PI)
5d0cda38-f302-498c-99fe-cc96df30cd4b.name: LEAN-AGILE Scrum Master Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: • Complete SAFe® Advanced Scrum Master (SASM) (class LZU 150 1732 delivered by Ericsson)1 • Current valid SAFe® SASM certification • 4 Completed Planning Increment (PI) Sessions working as a Scrum Master • 40 completed sprints1 working as a Scrum Master

5f9a3686-2c6d-4562-bea9-1a87c7d8dfeb.description: This badge is in recognition of the individual’s commitment to Ericsson MANA’s GenNext ERG. MANA’s GenNext is an ERG committed to promoting career development and motivating Ericsson’s emerging talent, providing a platform for elevating the voice of early career professionals, and creating a positive impact for our community. This individual has shown dedication to promoting the GenNext mission as well as helping to further develop themselves and their peers in their careers.
5f9a3686-2c6d-4562-bea9-1a87c7d8dfeb.name: MANA GenNext - Contributor Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of GenNext 2022 On-Demand Degreed Pathway. Attendance at 5 GenNext Events. Participation in 1 GenNext initiative (volunteering in tech camp, intern companion, etc.)

095522d4-1c8b-4121-b451-067ad567b4a6.description: The MANA PEIM badge is awarded to MANA Service Delivery Directors or Managers who demonstrate leadership by driving customer incident engagements from E2E based on their knowledge and skillsets.

c2610342-8193-4766-990c-5957d9aa7c8a.description: Earners of this badge have completed the MELA 5GC Hub deep 3-weeks hands-on 5GC experience and have demonstrated advanced knowledge of 5G Core within Ericsson and the industry. If no expiration date appears below, this badge does not expire.
c2610342-8193-4766-990c-5957d9aa7c8a.name: MELA 5GC Hands-on Experience 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Received after successful completion of the MELA DS Solution Integration Hub  developed MELA 5GC Hub deep 3-week hands-on 5GC experience.  This involves the hands-on deployment and integration of 5GC incl. CCD, PC and UDM,  the installation of a UE/RAN simulator, the execution of e2e use cases and  troubleshooting scenarios.

This certificate is awarded to people who have passed the assessment and been approved as such.
